Inter1_Rep01:
Surprisingly, water is flowing from the faucet.
Deciding to take advantage of it, you wash away the remaining slime.
Inter1_Rep03: Pools of bloody slime mixed with stone chips and organic matter.
Inter1_Rep04: Footprints lead from them toward the door.
Inter1_Rep05: The spilled liquid is of no use to you.
Inter1_Rep06: A trail of still-fresh blood stretches down the hallway.
Inter1_Rep07: It's unknown who or what left it, but the owner is nowhere to be seen.
Inter1_Rep08: At the end, it runs into a wall.
Inter1_Rep09:
An impressive oak counter.
That's it. The hotel is tidy and neatly laid out, and the thick registration book is open to the last page.
Inter1_Rep10: On the first line of a blank sheet of paper is a note: «4 new birds in our hotel. Come on, come up with something fun for them quickly!»,
Inter1_Rep11: It looks like the last «guest» before you was Tadeusz Broniewski in 1956.
Inter1_Rep12: Deepening into the hotel's occupancy history isn't of interest to you right now.
Inter1_Rep13:
Yellowed advertising brochures, famous fashion magazines, and a few pamphlets.
More than 30 years have passed since this waste paper was relevant.
Inter1_Rep14: A stack of leaflets advertising the ill-fated concert stands out among them.
Inter1_Rep15:
On the back of each of them is a crudely drawn portrait.
You You recognize some people who were with you at the very beginning, but later separated.
Inter1_Rep15_Chris: Fuck, I hope I don't run into those degenerates.
Inter1_Rep15_Selena:
What a pathetic style.
Suitable for this place.
Inter1_Rep15_Clarissa: Oh my god, that's the one who suggested we come up here.
Inter1_Rep16: A phone. You can hear the beeps now.
Inter1_Rep17: If you listen closely, you can hear the sounds of the forest more and more clearly through them.
Inter1_Rep18: That calmed you down a bit.
Inter1_Rep19: An old phone. What else would you expect?
Inter1_Rep20: The Administrator's clothes are rumpled and carelessly thrown onto a chair.
Inter1_Rep21: In some places, the silk fabric is marred by bullet holes.
Inter1_Rep22: A gilded badge on the chest announces the owner's name – Theodore Anzeba.
Inter1_Rep23:
A small local history corner.
The exhibit mainly tells the story of the indigenous people of this region.
Inter1_Rep24: The Abenaki Indians, who inhabited these vast forests, were eventually brutally exterminated by arriving Europeans.
Inter1_Rep25: Then came the first unsuccessful attempt to establish a long-term settlement. Then came the second, which was crowned with success and the subsequent emergence of Pilgrim City.
Inter1_Rep26: The subsequent fate of the indigenous people – Vegetation in reservations, assimilation, or the plunder of material culture to decorate a hotel.
Inter1_Rep27:
A scent catches your attention.
It comes from a large platter, heaped high with a still-hot dinner.
Inter1_Rep28:
You examine this gift warily.
Still, the previous cruel surprises left a bad taste.
Inter1_Rep29: Unable to restrain yourself, you carefully taste it. And...
Inter1_Rep31:
Nothing. No rot, blood, iron, or anything else.
Just delicious food that satiates you, giving your exhausted body a little strength.
Inter1_Rep32:
An old-fashioned sofa.
During your misadventures, someone or something brought it—and most of it The foyer is in order.
Inter1_Rep33:
Now the leather surface looks refreshed and clean.
You really want to lie down and relax a little.
Inter1_Rep34: Why deviate from what you've planned?
Inter1_Rep35: A short break has invigorated and strengthened you.
Inter1_Rep37:
A painting of the Appalachians.
Underneath it is a sign that reads: «A gift to the boarding house from the Grimswater family.»
Inter1_Rep37_Selena:
Oh! That's Thomas Cole, the Hudson River School.
It's nice to know someone in this wilderness has a sense of taste.
Inter1_Rep38: The image of majestic mountain landscapes has a calming effect on you.
Inter1_Rep38_Chris:
Wow. It's a scribble, but there's something to it.
Your brother would appreciate it, the bastard
Inter1_Rep39: No new details have appeared in the picture.
Inter1_Rep40:
An exquisite solid wood bar counter.
On the facade, a high relief depicts the life of an Indian settlement.
Inter1_Rep41:
All the dirty spots have disappeared. The dishes are polished to a shine.
The cleanliness is almost exemplary.
Inter1_Rep42:
The only missing detail is a helpful bartender behind the counter.
But you, having encountered the local offspring, don't mind his absence.
Inter1_Rep44:
At first glance, it's an ordinary elevator.
However, for you, it has become the embodiment of the gates leading to the circles of Hell.
Inter1_Rep45: Now it shows no signs of life.
Inter1_Rep46:
The doors, recently broken, now look brand new.
Now, instead of dilapidated wood, the exit is blocked by massive and indestructible oak doors.
Inter1_Rep47: The question of escape from this place is finally closed by three crossbeams.
Inter1_Rep48: It is impossible to open them without the appropriate keys.
Inter1_Rep49: The door is locked. A small trail of fresh foliage ends near it.
Inter1_Rep50:
An ornate wooden lectern, its beauty contrasted by the cheap magazine lying on it.
A piece of tree bark with a message is used as a bookmark.
Inter1_Rep51:
Upon opening the first page, you realize that they are advertising themed hotel rooms.
You study the first sentence in more detail.

Holy shit!

Well, At least Selena feels a little better.
Now we can go there.
Inter1_Clarissa22:
W-well, don't be scared! Everything will be fine.
On the count of three.
Inter1_Clarissa27: I still haven't helped in any way, and I doubt I can...
Inter1_Clarissa28: What can I say about myself anymore?
Inter1_Clarissa29: Maybe I really do deserve everything that's happening to me?
Inter1_Clarissa30: Why hide now? This punishment will teach me a lesson.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02: Oh my god. I'm so glad to see you.
Inter1_Cl_Sel06: This isn't happening, this isn't happening...
Inter1_Cl_Sel08: I can't leave her like this. Otherwise, no one will take care of the poor thing.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09: But what can I do? Hmm.
Inter1_Cl_Sel10: I have an idea! I need to find something hot around here – tea or coffee. Unlikely, but still.
Inter1_Cl_Sel11: Poor thing, I have to help her.
Inter1_Cl_Sel12:
Oh! This might do.
Better than nothing.
Inter1_Cl_Sel13:
Oh! Juice. I'm not really thirsty, of course.
So I'll keep it for now.
Inter1_Cl_Sel14: Even a pack of juice can't be deadly.
Inter1_Cl_Sel16: That's all there is to it.
Inter1_Cl_Sel17: She doesn't react to my words either.
Inter1_Cl_Sel18: So... there's nothing I can do to help her either.
Inter1_Cl_Sel20: Hey, Selena, w-why don't you say something?
Inter1_Cl_Sel22: Here, take this. It's not much, but it'll make you feel better.
Inter1_Cl_Sel23: Just take your time, everything's fine.
Inter1_Cl_Sel24: So, do you feel better now?
Inter1_Cl_Sel29: Don't talk nonsense. Would I just leave you in the lurch?
Inter1_Cl_Sel30: Ah-and the others... Is it just you?
Inter1_Cl_Sel31: Looks like it. At least I haven't encountered anyone else.
Inter1_Cl_Sel32: Or should there be someone else here?
Inter1_Cl_Sel35: I don't think I'll be of any use right now.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_01: Sorry to ask. You don't have to answer—no hard feelings.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_02: But how did you end up here?
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_05: Oh my God! So this happened to you too?
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_07: Well, it's the same for me. First, all sorts of horrors, monsters. And then...
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_08: It was very painful and very Scary. So here I am.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_09: So you... You were in that room?
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_10: A dirty and disgusting toilet, the worst I've ever seen?
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_11:
Yes. No. Different.
With a door that only Dr. Moreau could have designed.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_12: Brrrrr, I've never seen anything like that.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_13: Actually, Chris and I were just looking for you. And then...
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_15: Chris. Is he with you? Or... the same?
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_16: Oh! Everything will be fine with him, with a character like that. Worse than my older brother, I swear.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_17: Hmm. Since you're here, that means someone else will be here too.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_18: But I feel like we'll meet death more than once.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_19: There's only one way we can find out. But let's not talk about that now.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_20: Well, don't start talking about the inevitability of death again.
Inter1_Cl_Sel01_21: Mind you, I don't know much.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_01: Can you believe it? I visited my old house.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_02: It's like they climbed into my head and pulled out all sorts of things.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_04:
Well, someone has to be held accountable for this disgrace, right?
They're torturing us for a reason! It's not just that they're torturing us out of boredom!
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_05: You're right. I encountered some inconsistencies too.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_06:
Things that aren't typical for a hotel.
Wild eclecticism.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_07: But if there is someone responsible for this, then they're better at creating things with force than with imagination.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_08: Bad or not, this sick person...
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_09:
Someone there is clearly not planning on treating us to dessert and coffee.
But No one will give up so easily.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_10: Let him change and tweak the hotel as he pleases, we'll definitely get out of here.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_12:
Uh-huh! There, I've already found you. And then the others will follow.
Like Chris. Or Jeffrey.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_13: Besides, the lobby is perfectly safe, and nothing threatens us.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_16: This hotel is a living nightmare.
Inter1_Cl_Sel02_17: Mind you, I don't know much.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_01:
You said something about monsters.
Have you encountered any of them?
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_03:
Scary and evil. Especially that one, huge, all made of meat.
Brrrrr, I get goosebumps just thinking about it.
And the fear I suffered with them...
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_05: The worst thing I've ever experienced in my life.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_07: I shouldn't have shared this in such detail.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_10: They won't leave us alone. H-he and the others.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_11: No matter how long we hide in the foyer.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_12:
Maybe so.
But I'm definitely ready to meet you now.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_13: And I won't let anyone hurt you or anyone else.
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_14: Do you want to be everywhere at once?
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_15: Or you can create your own «A double?»
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_16:
M-maybe I can!
The main thing is that no one will lay their dirty paws on us now!
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_17: (God, she's right. I'll meet those freaks again. And I'll have to... take their lives again.)
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_18: (Okay! Put the negativity aside! Everything will work out.)
Inter1_Cl_Sel03_19: Have you ever come across any artist's tools?
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_01: Let's say. What can you tell me?
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_02:
Oh! There's so much to tell about me.
I'm actually from the Midwest. I grew up in a big family. We had our own farm. I had to take care of animals from a young age.
And then there were my brothers and sisters...
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_04: I get it, you have a rich biography.
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_05:
But let's focus on current.
What happened to you at the hotel?
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_06:
Well, I already told you. Chris and I went looking for you. Then things showed up that had nothing to do with the hotel.
And you already know the rest.
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_07:
You also said they got into your head.
Are there any secrets hidden there?
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_08: Something that could shake your optimism?
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_09: Or maybe you're a danger to others?
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_11: I wouldn't hurt a fly! But...
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_12:
But it's hard for me to talk about what happened here.
Sorry.
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_13:
Just as I thought.
Colossal convictions on feet of clay.
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_14:
Okay, let's not talk about that.
Your secrets are your business.
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_15:
You can ask about me.
That would be fair.
Inter1_Cl_Sel04_16: (Oh my God! I didn't know Selena could be LIKE THAT. Almost like Chris. Only she doesn't swear.)
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_02: Isn't that the one in the robe? Silent and unsociable.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_03: Yes, that's the one. Although what he did...
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_04: After that, I would NEVER call him a wallflower.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_07: By the way, have you seen him?
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_08:
The last time I saw him, he was lounging on this very couch, completely useless.
And his pet was always sitting next to him, so charming.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_10: I can only assume that their suffered the same fate as the others.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_11: Do you think he saw all that hotel abomination too?
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_13: However, it's possible that the metamorphoses here were more personal for him.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_14:
Oh my God. I REALLY hope he and his little friend are okay.
And he ends up here with us.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_16:
Hmm, I wonder if his dog can turn into a human here?
And his robe is quite professorial.
Inter1_Cl_Sel05_17: Keep in mind, I don't know much.
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_01: Then tell me, how did you end up in this town?
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_02:
Everyone chooses a certain path in life.
I chose mine and ended up here.
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_03: But the path doesn't equal the destination. Not in my case.
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_04:
Imagine this. A half-dead man in a canoe floating down a river, unable to influence anything.
That could describe my life.
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_05: It's a long chain of events. And it looks like it's coming to its natural conclusion.
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_06: You Are you satisfied with the answer?
Inter1_Cl_Sel06_08: (This whole death thing affected Selena more than I thought. So many dark thoughts...)
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_01:
So, how did you like the concert? I thought it was just great!
And Chris sings superbly.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_02: But, of course, he has the temperament of a field thorn.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_03:
Acceptable.
I've seen better, I've seen worse.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_04: But this one is definitely the most memorable on my meaningless path.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_05:
It's actually surprising that such a huge concert even happened in Pilgrim City.
This is definitely not up to par for our star.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_06: And did the star survive the fall from heaven to hell?
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_07:
Don't exaggerate. As I said, Chris will probably make it out alive.
And everyone else who was with us.
There's a whole crowd of them.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_09: Well, maybe it's not time yet.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_10: Or maybe they all perished in this damned place.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_11:
Of course, different things happen here.
But not so much that you can't handle such a horde.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_12: Everything will be fine, you'll see.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_13: I doubt he's safe and sound.
Inter1_Cl_Sel07_14: Mind you, I don't know much.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_01: Do you think there might be other animals here?
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_02: You mean strays? Or wild ones?
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_03: Both. The hotel, judging by Apparently, it's been empty for years.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_04: Hmm. That could really be true.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_05: It's scary to even think that a pack of wild dogs lives here.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_06: Or wolves. Or something even more terrifying.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_07:
But then they shouldn't die either.
That means they're as trapped as we are.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_08: And any animal will be angrier than a cloud if you treat it badly.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_09: I won't presume to speculate about the nature of this place.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_10:
But an animal is an animal.
Especially dogs.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_12: Sorry to say this, but it seems like you have something personal with them.
Inter1_Cl_Sel08_14: Domestic dogs don't exist. They're only slightly more obedient than wild ones.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_01: By the way, how did you end up in this town?
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_03: Since we're in this situation, we might as well get to know each other better. You, for example, can always ask about me. I'll tell you a lot.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_04: And how will this help us?
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_05:
This way we can easily trust each other.
I tell everyone this at training sessions; we even start them with communication.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_07: I just came to this backwater. That's all.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_09:
Yes. No touching or tragic stories.
You could say my presence here is almost accidental.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_11:
Except maybe the excellent views of nature.
Much better than in Richmond.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_12:
If all this hadn't happened, I would have loved to capture the local mountains on canvas.
But…
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_14:
Don't give up.
If you say you want to paint the local nature, then so be it.
Inter1_Cl_Sel09_17: Keep in mind, I don't know much.
